src:
El fiscal pide un veredicto de culpabilidad para Miguel López para que "un crimen horrible no quede sin castigo"
El Ministerio Público defiende que los indicios son suficientes para condenar al acusado y que no hay otras alternativas
06 Nov 2019, 12:29 by mercedes gallego
El fiscal ha pedido al jurado popular un veredicto de culpabilidad para Miguel López por la muerte a tiros de su suegra, María del Carmen Martínez, para que "un crimen horrible no quede sin castigo". En un alegato final cercano a las dos horas ha defendido que hay indicios suficientes para respaldar una condena.
A su criterio no hay alternativas que excluyan la participación de López en la muerte de la viuda del expresidente de la CAM Vicente Sala. Entre los indicios, el fiscal José Llor ha explicado las malas relaciones entre la familia por el control de las empresas que llegaron a una situación de ruptura total. Una mala relación que estaba aún peor en el caso de la familia del acusado donde la situación era "de odio".
El fiscal ha asegurado que el móvil del crimen fue sobre todo el poder por el control de una empresa que facturaba 239 millones en ventas. El representante del Ministerio Público ha insistido en que el acusado conoce las armas y utiliza un calibre como el empleado, incidiendo en que se encargó de preparar el escenario y que Miguel López estuvo en Novocar en el momento de los disparos. El fiscal ha descartado tanto la hipótesis del robo o de un sicario por los negocios de Sudamérica.
Las conversaciones de Miguel López recogidas en el caso Sala
"Me da una pena que te cagas, no por mi suegra sino por la situación"



"Mi suegra era una mujer muy volátil. Hoy era blanco, mañana negro"



"Vicente es actor profesional. Nunca nos informaba de los negocios en Latinoamérica"



Fany Sala a su hijo:"Eres gilipollas. Era mi madre y era tu abuela"
text:
The prosecutor asks for a guilty verdict for Miguel López so that "a horrible crime does not go unpunished"
The Public Ministry defends that the evidence is sufficient to condemn the accused and that there are no other alternatives
06 Nov 2019, 12:29 by mercedes gallego
The prosecutor has asked the popular jury for a guilty verdict for Miguel López for the shooting death of his mother-in-law, María del Carmen Martínez, so that "a horrible crime does not go unpunished." In a final plea close to two hours he has defended that there are sufficient indications to support a conviction.
At his discretion there are no alternatives that exclude López's participation in the death of the widow of the former president of the CAM Vicente Sala. Among the indications, prosecutor José Llor has explained the bad relations between the family by controlling the companies that reached a situation of total breakdown. A bad relationship that was even worse in the case of the defendant's family where the situation was "hateful."
The prosecutor has assured that the motive of the crime was mainly the power for the control of a company that invoiced 239 million in sales. The representative of the Public Ministry has insisted that the defendant knows the weapons and uses a caliber like the employee, emphasizing that he was in charge of preparing the stage and that Miguel López was in Novocar at the time of the shooting. The prosecutor has ruled out both the hypothesis of robbery or a hitman for business in South America.
Miguel López's conversations included in the Sala case
"I feel sorry that you screw up, not because of my mother-in-law but because of the situation"



"My mother-in-law was a very volatile woman. Today she was white, tomorrow black"



"Vicente is a professional actor. He never informed us of business in Latin America"



Fany Sala to his son: "You're an asshole. He was my mother and he was your grandmother."
